Events that occurred on 30 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1920 - Actor Norman Bird is born.
1931 - J.R.R. Tolkien is appointed supervisor for B.Litt student A.F. Colborn.
1936 - Rayner Unwin, aged 10, writes a "Report on the Hobbit".
1965 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to his grandson Michael George, published as Letter 279.
1965 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to J.L.N. O'Loughlin.
1995 - Actor Andy Pessoa is born.
2001 - The parody book The Roadkill of Middle Earth is published.
2005 - RingCon V at SeaTac, Washington.
2006 - Finding God in The Hobbit is published.
2010 - Mereth Aderthad XVI, or "EstelCon" of the Spanish Tolkien Society in Valenica, Spain.
2010 - Looking for the King: An Inklings Novel is published.
2014 - The Hobbit and Tolkien's Mythology is published.
2014 - Arda Inhabited is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
T.A. 3019:
Gandalf and the four Hobbits leave Bree.[1] Gandalf leaves to visit Tom Bombadil.
Night: The Travellers come to the Brandywine Bridge.[1]
Full moon[2]
